channel.title: MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Sanju’s Belly/One by One | 4 | MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries
item.description: Podcast Description “Sanju’s Belly” For decades, a 36-year-old Indian man has been plagued by a mysterious swelling in his belly. He refuses to see a doctor, until one day, he’s rushed to the hospital with breathing problems. When doctors operate, what they find inside him is horrific. “One by One” A family in 1860s London is struck by a mysterious illness that claims three of their children. When the city’s finest physician is brought in to treat the family's last surviving child, a three-year-old girl, he is baffled by her symptoms.

item.title: A Change in Fortune | 3 | MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries
item.description: Podcast Description On a hot September day in 1986, a family in Goiania, Brazil, suddenly begin feeling sick after a celebration. The symptoms are horrific: vomiting, diarrhea, and bleeding. But one family member suspects something far worse. Her hunch soon leads to a devastating discovery. item.title: Tigers on the Ceiling | 2 | MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries
item.description: Podcast Description In 1951, dozens of people in the small French town of Pont St. Esprit fall ill with nausea, chills, and stomach pains. At first, the local doctor suspects food poisoning, but when the symptoms turn into hallucinations, violence, and even suicide, he realizes that something much more sinister is at play. item.title: Ashes to Ashes | 1 | MrBallen’s Medical Mysteries
item.description: Podcast Description In the Spring of 1986, a man discovers that his elderly father has been trapped inside his home that was devastated by a fire. But no one can figure out what caused the fire – or what exactly happened to the man’s father. When medical science can’t explain it, one investigator turns to a strange phenomenon to find answers.
